newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Salomon starts client/server cos.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Salomon starts client/server cos.

text.p: -- Salomon analyst Neil Herman said Thursday he initiated coverage of four client server software companies.
-- In published comments, the analyst rated Germany's SAP AG as a strong buy, describing it as the "King Kong" of the client/server software applications business.
-- Advent Software Inc and PeopleSoft Inc were given "buy" recommendations, while Baan NV of the Netherlands was rated a hold.
-- While Herman said he considered Baan a top-flight company, he noted that it competes head-to-head in markets with SAP, a far larger company.
-- In addition, he said he considered Baan stock overpriced at 100 times his 1996 earnings estimate and 67 times his 1997 estimate.

-- Herman ranked SAP with the likes of global computer industry leaders such as Microsoft Corp, Intel Corp, Oracle Corp and Compaq Computer Corp, noting how SAP has four times the market share of the second-place competitor in its field.
-- He estimated SAP will have a 35 percent compound annual growth rate through the year 2000, earnings growth of 41 percent over the next two years and rising operating margins.
-- Herman said that although PeopleSoft shares appear expensive on a price/earnings analysis, "we believe a pattern of continuing positive earnings surprises is very possible."
-- In mid-afternoon trading Baan was off 3/4 at 34-7/8.
